author: {'steamid': '76561198113888508', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 867, 'last_played': 1632212368}
review:
I stumbled across this game when I accidentally opened steam while trying to open the logitech profiler (Which was next to steam on the task bar.) Best mistake ever.

Pros

1. Realistic handling. The way the handling operates is brilliant. The understeer and lift off oversteer that you would get from a front wheel drive touring car are so accurate that it's unbelivable.

2.  Compatibility with slower computers. My computer has 4GB of ram and a 1.4GHz processor. Not one problem with the smoothness of the game and the graphics aren't even that bad. Why do you need any better graphics thn this, it might look cool but really the graphics in this are just fine

3. IT'S FREE!!!!!!!!!!!!

Cons

1. Takes a while to set up, First I didn't realise it had defaulted with all assists on and the controls were with the keyboard. Once I made the wheel work and turned off the assists the force feedback was steering the car for me so I then realised about negative force feedback, which solved my problem.

2. Strange AI behaviour and bad penalty system on the formation lap the AI are extremely slow and when I tried out the rolling start the AI started overtaking each other and the saftey car on the formation lap. When I tried to test the damage module I went straight down the inside of another car at full speed destroying their car (and not mine) I only got a warning.

In summary I will say this quickly. GET THIS GAME RIGHT NOW!

author: {'steamid': '76561198163996485', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1440420678}
review:
Overall, it's a 6.5/10

I can see it was at least inspired by GTR2, as it shares a lot of design choices. But it just falls short when compared.
There are 4 different cars in the entire game, each with 2 different liveries. But they all feel the same.
there are also 6 different tracks in the entire game, each with it's own feel to them. Nothing bad to say here.
Options have been made well, there's a lot to change, controls, audio, display, and also difficulty of the game and rules of the races.

And then there's the driving physics. None of these cars have ever spun on me, even with every driving assist off. They just feel as if they were FWD, is that supposed to be that way? Other than that, clutch works, brakes do lock, and You do lose control in certain situations, but it's way too easy.
Same goes to the rival AI, once passed they do nothing to get their position back, and even before You pass them they seem like they were just moving obstacles on the road.

Graphics are... not that bad actually, the contrast etc is fairly well balanced, but everything else is just not there. True, there are working real-time shadows of the cars and the track but... that's it. No real-time car reflections, they're just reflecting the skybox (which isn't any good either, just about 20 small clouds on the sky), no motion blur, no depth of field, nothing! It's the middle of 2015, what were you thinking?
Sound is nice, You can hear everything happening around You, Cars do sound a little different but that's it, nothing spectacular again.

Long review short, it's an average game when compared to other racing "simulators" out there, but from what I've seen, it's a good way to get into "arcade-simulator racing" as I call it. There aren't many cars to master, and they all feel the same so it's not a huge hop to change a car, the tracks aren't too hard to master, the AI isn't too hard and unforgiving, etc etc.

So if You're new to the simulator genre, have an old computer which can't run modern games and a steering wheel do get it. It's for free so You can find out if You're going to like simulator racing or not. But if You do, please do get GTR2 and find some mods for it because that is the best way to get into "hardcore simulator racing". It's from 2005 so Your PC will run it, and it has a damn well written physics engine.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965088638', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1440084941}
review:
Briefly.

CONS

1) defualt assist settings mean the car drives itself effectively. Just remember when to lift at the end of the straights.

2) change the assists and the car still tries to steer itself a little in the corners. Set the FFB to above zero and you can feel it. at +50% (yes it is possible to have -50%) you end up fighting the wheel to strighten up to the line out of the corners.

3) if you don't like the bumper view the camera options are horrible

4) I tired interlagos for 20 minutes. At the end of the pit straight the braking markers on the right side are missing and with the camera view it is impossible to judge the braking distance. I did 10 laps and went off every time.

5) Although it has many defualt wheel configs they all need to be customised and it's not immediately obvious how you do it.

Pros

1) race 07/rfacetor engine.

2) defualt setup for the evo (only car i tried) is good. very grippy and stable.

3) free

Conclusion

If you are new to racing games. This is one to try. It will help teach you the racing lines and how a car should feel before you dive into something like LFS/ Race 07/Asstto Corsa. If you have any experience, it's best to avoid unless you want an easy game to play while drinking and driving but the Need For Speed games exist for that purpose.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972285374', 'num_games_owned': 2225, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1439153401}
review:
There will be people who will say I didnt spend long enough ingame to have a valid opinion however, I am a serious sim racer. I`ve been playing sim games for many years now, gtlegends, rfactor, race07, iracing and rfactor2, i`ll even spout I own what I would class as arcade racers ie shift 1,2 dirt 1,2,3 f1 2010 etc etc.... 

My setup does not involve a joypad if your gonna play a sim then buy a wheel its that simple, I love my g27.

Onto Copa

Graphics: the gfx are poor for a game this recent, a mediocre laptop could run this at full whack and not suffer.
Sound: music was ok in menu, car sounds suck massive unicorn wang! meaning they are the worst Ive ever heard.
control: wheel setup was easy, the cars feel very unrealistic even running on veteran settings.
Online: is there an online? i dunno it was uninstalled after about 10 mins.

conclusion: If your a serious sim racer avoid this game at all costs you will be nothing but disappointed with it even given the fact that its free. If your an arcade racer then I spose its ok but my 2 cents would say to look elsewhere for arcade racers, I would even recommend the original Grid game over this. The only plus` I can give this game is the inmenu music and the ui is easy enough to navigate. 

So all being said serious sim racers not wanting to spend money on iracing dont get this lol,,, do yourself a favour and get rfactor2 or even race07, you will have far more fun with those titles... now excuse me while I load up rfactor2 and go hit nord in autumn on full HD with the nissan gtr :) nuff said,,, avoid copa unless your an arcade racer!!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197996110178', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1438782180}
review:
It's a simulation, not an arcade. So if you want some funny arcade game, this is not your cup of tea. Graphics is working under Direct-X 9, very nice models, but nowadays it looks like the graphics in racing games in years between 2006 - 2008. Engine sounds are not very real, but this is a same problem, like Project Cars, GRID2, and lots of other car racing games have, so do not be dissapointed. I have been playing this about less than 15 minutes? Behind view is very funny, you just see only your seat, nothing else behind. :D No damage model (but it is understandable, most car producers does not want crashing their cars in racing games) If you do not have anything else, it is free, so you can say "it is still better than nothing" and I am really confident, there will be someone who will like this "game" or "racing simulation". Very real looks interior view, where no hands are holding your racing wheel, but you can look left and right and the interior looks very nice. If they put some DX 11 efects, this game would be very nice to watch. This game looks designer for racing wheel owners, it worked on my keyboard, but it was weird and every corner I was telling myself "If I had a steering wheel, if I hade a steering wheel!!!" But on the replay videos It looked just fine.

So...Recomend or not? Definitely recommend! It's free and steering wheel owners with older PC could be satisfied. If you have slower computer, so you will be probably satisfied with Graphics and you can play it for free. What else would you like from this game?!

author: {'steamid': '76561198118930331', 'num_games_owned': 68, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1467571690}
review: Muito legal. Funciona bem, gr√°ficos bons, muito divertido. Surpreendeu, principalmente por ser um jogo gratuito. O jogo foi feito para divulgar o campeonato e cumpre muito bem o papel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008511567', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1453931676}
review: Ok, so I've had this downloaded for some time, but never played it as I thought, for a free game its going to be rubbish,  only played a couple of laps, getting controllers set up etc, an I can say I'm pretty impressed, not sure why this has had so many negative views to be honest, the graphics are very good, not project car good, not even close, but games like race etc, hands down beats it. but I guess thats not the most important thing in a race game is it. Its the handling and how it "feels", well again I've many race games on and off steam, and I think so far this is great, its responsive and you can tell understeer etc, so tuning shouldnt be too hard. over all i'm very impressed, and I'l recommend it on the brief anount of game play I have had. after all I have paid for racing games that I have really regretted. I cant think of many free racing sim games better than this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998146968', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1437189107}
review:
With extensive experience in just about every Sim since the original Microprose Grand Prix games, includng time in earlier iterations of GSC, I really only needed half an hour of hotlapping to know exactly what you get with tis title.
This is solid racing title, based and built on a tried and true, if ageing engine by a studio witha great reputation.

And it is free.

Having read some of the negative reviews, I have only come to the conclusion that they have been written by those with limited sim experience, who believe that plugging in an xbox controller and expecting to be able to drive this is the way to go.

No.

Get a wheel. Otherwise you are gimping yourself of any drivability and you will miss out on just how good titles such as this can be.

Control of your inputs, smooth accceleration, controlled braking, finesse in the steering is what these titles are designed for. Pressing A to go and X to stop is just...wrong.

You get a handful of cars and tracks for your money...which is $0, and that gives you enough content to keep a driver satisfied for sometime. Learing how each car drives, and then mastering it whilst learning all the intricacies of a track
is what you do here. It is not a matter of "Grats Dude! You just drove 3 laps in Shiny Supercar A, not go take Extra Shiny Super Car B for a spin! Put it on Youtube!"

Pro points:

All content free.
Nice cars.
Good tracks
Tried and tested engine.
Great FFB

Cons:

Whilst engine is good, and you will get super high FPS, it is a touch dated. 
Bring this into a next gen engine and Sim drivers will need to clean the white stains off their undershorts.
Thats about it for the cons really.

Titles such as this, for free, and others you can get pretty cheap these days, such as GTR2, the Race series, Rfactor 1 are still very enjoyable, great to drive and extrememly entertaining.

If you are new to simming and looking for titles to cut your teeth before investing more heavily, and you have a half decent FFB wheel, get this. Then go buy Stock Car Extreme.

review:
This game is great. The AI are amazing. The sounds are really good. My only annoyance was that the end of the race didn't work properly. It was supposed to be the last lap of the timed race, but instead it added an extra lap. Was lots of fun though. I have no idea why the reviews are "mixed" I think they should be "Mostly Positive"

I have a G27 for Gran Turismo 6, and I an the 150th fastest person in the world on it, 32nd fastest in the USA. I was too lazy to move it to the PC, I just used a keyboard with only ABS:High everything else off. AI I used 100%/100% And I got 3rd place in my first race. I really enjoyed it, I have some real life racing to do right now, but Im excited to practice Interlagos some more when I get back. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198012545565', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 242, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1508545713}
review:
Game does not work. Goes to config window, then instantly shuts down when you click on the OK button to actually play!

author: {'steamid': '76561198107175527', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1440433579}
review:
Sim Players are passionate when it comes to driving, flying or even riding the vehicles that have either thrilled and amazed us during our childhood even still do today which is why we take time out to write great reviews .. so I‚Äôd just like to add something to that ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶
It‚Äôs always a shame to read about the disappointments that a fellow Sim Player has experienced instead of reading about their delights as they have taken the controls of their favourite consist and proudly taken passengers or goods from their chosen station, port or yard and delivered them on time having faced realistic challenges of schedules, other transport or sometimes signal failures and adverse weather conditions - that inner sense of achievement (and self-pride) is all we really seek - Yes they may be after all only simulations of real modes of transport ‚ÄìBUT‚Ä¶. be it an incredible landing of a fully laden 300 ton Boeing 747-400 on a real time flight from Singapore to Heathrow - Microsoft Flight Simulator perhaps - where you take care of the Jumbo's flight deck and using the array of true to life switches, levers and dials as you descend gently down to terra firma ‚Äì EGLL runway 21 to be exact to the [imagined] sounds of cheers and applause of your satisfied passengers and crew. Or that inner voice that says 'yees!' when we finally arrive at the depot and park up our Flexi-Bus for the day OMSI 2‚Äì its late, the sun has set, both outside our windows (if we care to look!) and within the Sim‚Ä¶ but we don‚Äôt care.. We‚Äôve driven with diligence and skill, we‚Äôve hit n hurt no one and managed to pick up and drop off everyone without a hitch‚Ä¶ that‚Äôs what matters.. That‚Äôs why we play these Simulators ‚Äì 
That‚Äôs what Sims do for us! - They fulfil our innermost desire to be a part of something that we admire, to take control of the very vehicles that we venerate and are in awe of ‚Äì Hours of our lives are spent recreating the paths taken by Road, Rail, Air and Sea in order that we may share the experience in some intangible way of that of the Driver, Pilot, Captain, Fireman, Soldier and Doctor? within us all ‚Äì all this achieved speedily at the flick of a mouse button and without the arduous years of universities, specialist training and professional advice and preparation, we will not suffer any loss of limb if we make mistakes as we learn the art of take-off and landing, nor will we face litigation and inevitable imprisonment from the families of the loved ones that we lost at sea due to our lack of experience of sailing cruise ships, or even suffer from docked wages from South West Trains for continued late arrivals at London Victoria‚Ä¶ Friends our desire and task is a simple one ‚Ä¶ to Simulate through our chosen modes ‚Ä¶ without the Wind, Rain, Ice, Snow or Insurance Costs ever affecting or view of our chosen destination - 
To Dream the Impossible is what drives the human spirit ‚Äì But to deny someone of that dream is to deny them of the very lust for life ‚Ä¶.. So keep dreaming keep ‚ÄòSimming‚Äô and whether it‚Äôs by Air, Sea or Land may your journeys be filled with fun, passion and excitement ‚Äì 
Sim on! n Smile as you go!

author: {'steamid': '76561198144322342', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1597223840}
review:
as a freebie i have no complaints about this game.I am not the best at driving games
and as i just bought a g27 thought i would look for a game to learn my wheel on.
So first i amjust using settings where the wheel does the gear changes and i do the braking and slowly i am getting the hang of it.On the game itself the graphics are not it's strong suit but as a person who was 18 when pong was released i have seen very low graphics over the years and one thing i have learned the best graphics don't always make a good game.My only complaint for me is when i first played i got motion sickness due to the bouncy car and only being able to look through the windscreen then i got in to the settings and that solved that problem.Are there better looking games out there of course there is but for what you are getting for FREE i think this game is ace.

Para aqueles que est√£o iniciando em jogos de corrida ele possui um √≥timo sistema que auxilia na pilotagem deixando quase tudo a cargo da inteligencia artificial, exceto a utlrapassagem. √© bem facil de configurar. author: {'steamid': '76561198095118283', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1435160152}
review:
I tend to review games in different sections people tend to look for:
Graphics: 68/100. The Cars them selves look very nice. The surroundings are not particularly great, however you shouldnt notice it if you are looking where you are going! ;)
User Interface (UI): 46/100. It doesnt look the prettiest. Simple design however it feels like it's the wrong colours that just make it look... not right?
Artificial Intelligence (AI): 96/100. The AI feels perfect. They notice that your there (unlike other tittles recently). They know if you are faster then them then they would move over to let you through. But dont think it's that easy ;) If a bot wants to challenge they will. You can get some really good battles.
Frames Per Second (FPS): 85/100. I didn't have many FPS drops when playing it that were particularly noticeable. I wasnt sure how many frames I do drop because I had to use the Keyboard to drive, due to the game not noticing my wheel. 
Sounds: 87/100. The car sounds are good. The music is meh, but you can turn tht off in the menu. The game notices what type of terrain you driving over, for example when going over rumble strips, you for sure know you are. 
Content: Currently at 68/100. There are only the one class of car currently in the game. There are about 6 different race tracks. About 4 different types of car. Single race, Test day and Championship. I am not sure if they are planning to add more content in the furture?
Controls: 72/100. The game does have a few wheels that it knows, such as G25 or the G27 and some Thrustmaster ones like the TM 500. You can use a Xbox gamepad and your keyboard. (If you do use your Keyboard make sure to check the keybinding's)
Overall rating = 73/100
Overall great for a Free to Play! If you like racing games then I would suggest this to you. Only a small download nothing big. Good base to the game if they want to make more content. Few problems with the UI looking weird, all in all, worth the download.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041636187', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1459986630}
review: BUENISIMO! La mejor experiencia gratuita en simuladores de manejo hasta el momento! Es COMPLETAMENTE gratis, tenes varios modelos de autos para elegir y tambien varios circuitos... Muy bien llevado a cabo, la IA es excelente y se puede configurar hasta el nivel de agresividad de la misma. Los graficos estan OK, pero los que se descargan este juego estan buscando una buena sensacion al volante, no un para√≠so grafico. Lo unico es que la interfaz me parece un poco confusa y tiene algunos problemas de estabilidad, pero esperemos que los desarrolladores sigan trabajando para ampliar la experienca! Muy bueno!

author: {'steamid': '76561198004379022', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1432667613}
review:
I like Race07 and its add on's and I saw this on steam. I pondered for a while - and then said ok I'll try it. When you load the game you need to take a little time to change settings. I changed the gearshift and throttle/brake/left/right and then got to it.

Very surprised how good, and how polished this game is. Recommended to ALL car racing players, you deserve this in your collection. Its a shame its single player, but a great game none the less. I really think they did a nice job with this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121143348', 'num_games_owned': 874, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 313, 'last_played': 1431354783}
review:
Das BESTE Rennspiel aller Zeiten ! (wenn man nach Preis/Leistung geht)

Diese Simulation ist in ihrer Perfektion nicht zu √ºbertreffen.
Die Physik ist grandios, ebenso wie die Optik von Autos und Strecken.
Der Sound ist akkurat, wenn auch nicht wirklich sch√∂n, was allerdings an den Autos liegt und nicht am Spiel.
Die Grafik ist f√ºr so eine alte Engine echt noch sehr ansehnlich: Hochaufgel√∂ste Texturen und stimmige Beleuchtungseffekte. Die KI macht ihren Job so gut es eben geht, es ist halt KI...

WICHTIG: Nur weil es FTP ist, macht es das Spiel nicht gleich Casual. Es ist eine Simulation die ein gutes Lenkrad voraussetzt !



Wem dieses Spiel gef√§llt, sollte sich danach mal Stock Car Extreme anschauen, das ist von den gleichen Leuten gemacht, die √ºbrigens allesamt ehemalige Modder sind.

review:
Very good racing simulator, although it doesn't have much variety. The physics are excellent and force feedback is exemplary. AI is very good and they are quite aggressive. Actually, AI is even better than on Assetto Corsa or pCARS and will avoid collisions mid-curves.

By the way, you will need a wheel to fully appreciate this game. And come on, it's free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198159230642', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1430668427}
review:
Seriously don't bother getting this game. It is a waste of time and effort and I can't think of anything good to say about it. Don't look at the pictures from the ads at the top. The in game graphics are completely different and I'm surprised the gamemakers even had the cheek to put those high-resolution pictures on the page. The whole point of it is to show what the game is like. 

Bad:
*Graphics
*Cars
*Controls
*Gameplay

Good:
???

Overall if you want a good track racing game from steam go for Asseto Corsa or Project Cars, definately not this one.

1. Die Grafik!!! Ok, es ist ein free2play Game, aber dennoch h√§tte die Grafik viel besser sein k√∂nnen, leute ich bitte euch.
2. Die Fahrphysik. Ich kann ihr nicht mal ansatzweise vorstellen das sich ein Rennwagen so fahren l√§sst. Der Lenkrad einschlag ist so schnell das sogar die Geschwindigkeit des Lichts dagengen wie eine Schnecke aussieht.
3. Die Kameras. Beschi√üene Kamerawinkel die den restlichen Spielspa√ü (wenn man √ºberhaupt jemals einen in diesem Spiel hatte) in die Tonne tritt!

author: {'steamid': '76561198038775340', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1600813052}
review:
Muito bom!

Pelo que eu percebi, este jogo parece usar a mesma engine do GTR2, um famoso simulador de corridas para PCs que √© desenvolvido pela SimBin (deste a√≠ tamb√©m saiu o Volvo - The Game). Assim, n√£o tive dificuldades em jog√°-lo ou de configurar os controles.

De um lado, ele possui os mesmos problemas do GTR2, como a configura√ß√£o de controles nada simplificada e paradas de box bem esquisitas. Sem falar dos gr√°ficos que s√£o um pouco ultrapassados para hoje.

Por outro lado, ele possui uma f√≠sica bem realista e aquela jogabilidade que todo simulador de corrida deveria ter. Ent√£o, se voc√™ considera este jogo muito dif√≠cil de controlar e reclama de sua f√≠sica, √© melhor voltar para games de corridas do tipo arcade, como Need for Speed, Forza e similares.

Este merece um joinha!

review: O jogo √© bom. Ver pistas nacionais e carros utilizados pelas equipes brasileiras √© muito bom. Para mim o ponto negativo √© n√£o ter a vis√£o total do carro. Sei que para muitos ter a vis√£o interna torna o jogo mais realista, por√©m n√£o podemos esquecer de que jogos de corrida n√°o √© s√≥ para pilotos mas tamb√©m para divertimento e isso para alguns se torna melhor com a vis√£o total do carro, para melhor controle (para alguns) do tra√ßado na pista. Contudo n√£o deixaria de recomedar o jogo. N√£o √© pesado, n√£o requer de uma m√°quina superpotente e garante um tempinho para pilotar e se divertir, qualquer idade que voc√™ tenha.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069198793', 'num_games_owned': 207, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1443435433}
review:
Definitely a fun game. You get a lot in this game for free. Multiple car manufacturers, and plenty of tracks to keep you entertained. My PC is currently having a bit of a derp, so once that issue is sorted out, I'll definitely be buying a Logitech G27 or a similar wheel and pedal set for this.

Pros
No nonsense graphics
Plenty of manufacturer and track variety
FREE
You have the option to just trundle about if you so wish

Cons
AI can be a little weird
Small amount of pop-in and stutter noted, it may just be because of my graphics card.


Just so you know what I'm running

Mobo: Asus Sabertooth Z97 Mk2
CPU: Intel Core i5 4690k at 4.2GHz
GPU: HIS IceQx HD6950 2GDDR5
RAM: 8GB G.Skill Ripjaws CL8 1600Mhz


All in all, VERY fun game. Highly recommend as an alternative to Asetto Corsa or iRacing if you're not in a position to make game purchases at the time.

EDIT: Issue fixed, dodgy overclock was at fault.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002974617', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1603276473}
review:
The simple and honest FACT about this game is, that it IS infact just rFactor1.  With a rearranged and revamped UI skin.  Once you pass the first screen its painfully obvious what you are playing because no matter how you skin it, rFactor, stands out from its other clones like Race 07 and all of its variants.   The time favored menu options are still here.  Now the dead giveaway for me was the garage and its tuning options. The UI is so annoying and confusing to navigate to accomplish whatever tuning or changes you wish to make.  
Loading out onto the track was like a joke. It screamed GTMAX world touring car mod (a rFactor user made mod) from 2011. Same Toyota, however this Focus version is new, seen this Lancer before.   Although these modders make a better default cockpit view. Its more like looking through a person with two eyes , than that narrow perspective ass rFactor "I must have only one eye" FOV.

 The controls by far, hands down, are a billion times more understandable and appreciated over rFactors shit for sensory feed back.   It seems like rFactor was geared towards idiots with logitech wheels, and not really followed by people with actual quality made devices.   As if the modder community just are a bunch of blow hards.  I do play rFactor  as a die hard fan, since it came out. But what I say is true.     This game without even touching any settings I chose to set out onto the track to see how "factor" like it was, and was proven wrong.  I was so happy to see that my first turn, that i said to myself "this is just about how i would steer if I were sitting in this car" actually gave the car the direction I wanted.      

 Excellent job guys. That alone is something to cheer about.  Though being an rFactor fan, it makes me wonder if the settings we see and the choices that are configured in the .PLR file are set with some options that are in place to create that superb handling.

  Such as the fact that I cannot do anything about my infant drivers weak ass neck and his floppy loppy head banging around in the cockpit.  That shit is so wrong for one god damn reason. Yes G forces will batter your head from side to side, but, our amazing "anti skip technology" built in to our eyes, prevents us from having that unuseable sight of vibration.  Eyeballs let us look to the side without moving our heads. They allow the head to move without the area we are viewing to pan tilt or skew whilst our heads move along dang near any axis.     If my noodle neck driver could just hold his head still, (and option in all other games using this sim engine) it would be so much more fun to play.  But as  I inspected the games files I am to belive they acomplish their handles by using a slightly different approach. And I think its that they use the games physics engine in a different way. I believe this game bases the cars handles off of the drivers head physics, versus the other games having the .HDV file, the SUSP.pm, the , tires.tbc, and a few other components to configure how your car would feel on the track.  

    Whatever it is, great job.
Questionable though I just find this game after its makers get bought out.
You guys going to do a clone port of rFactor 2?
That would be awesome if you keep improving the steering experience.  
:D

author: {'steamid': '76561198015823359', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1428641790}
review: Very poor game to be honest. I have played better indie car games om the browser than this. The control and physics (that is non existing) are very bad. So bad that I tried playing with my Xbox 360 controller, only to find out that it poorly support it and I have to remap ALL the bottoms as it's unlike any other car games. Even by then, it is still unplayable and you are still forced to use your keyboard for some functions.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993324433', 'num_games_owned': 488, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1431893100}
review:
I am by no means a sim racer. A leisurely chilled sim driver maybe, but not a racer.
My only gear is an almost ten year old Logitech Formula Force EX wheel with a somewhat flimsy pedal set, but the driving enjoyment I get out of this title, even with such meager equipment, is immense.
Reiza Studios is a well-established simulation master, and rightfully so. This is the perfect free promotion for their paid title, Game Stock Car Extreme, which I am thoroughly thinking of buying in the near future.
I mean, if a free 1.9 GB download can make me smile like a little boy on Christmas Day, why wouldn't a fully-decked sim with lots of content do the same?

Take it out for a spin and you will see what I mean.

10/10 without any exaggeration whatsoever.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977190504', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1429497227}
review:
I'm an accomplished tech, so when I post a problem about this game crashing and I get a WIP troubleshooting link from the dev, that seems a bit poor. I have a really up-to-date PC with every damn update for drivers and a top end graphics card. But still the game crashes after about 45 seconds when ever you try to drive. Then the dev locks the support topic so I can't respond. That's poor support and poor troubleshooting resolution.

My advice, don't bother and get Assetto Corsa instead, at least you get decent support.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042406646', 'num_games_owned': 152, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1442099970}
review:
Copa Petrobras de Marcas is a game based on the well-known rFactor engine by ISI, and that is a big thing in this game: this engine is known for its lifelike physics simulation, tons of customisation options and modding features. The result is that the game offers a solid, reliable driving experience similar to games such as GTR and F1 Challenge 99-02, though in a different scenario: Brazilian racecars and circuits, recreated with great attention to detail - thanks Reiza Studios!

It is important to notice that, as a serious race simulation, the game requires a steering wheel if you want to enjoy what it has to offer. Graphics are a bit outdated, but the overall driving experience, the sound and the detailed models make up for it. On the other hand, the game doesn't require a Master Race desktop setup.

If you're Brazilian, you know what to expect. If you're not, it's chance to know some tracks popular in Ayrton Senna's country, and take some popular vehicles such as the Focus, the Lancer and the Corolla for a drive. In the real competition, these cars are equipped with a similar engine and a fixed ratio gearbox (this aspect was thoroughly recreated in the game).

Most importantly, Copa Petrobras de Marcas is free to play. Not the microtransaction type, it is actually free! Great driving model, accurate vehicles and tracks, realistic sound and a highly competitive AI for free - quite a deal, aye?

author: {'steamid': '76561197965432057', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1706926038}

please expand on this reiza, just dont go crazy corporate fascist with micro/macro transactions, let em pay for fluff like paint jobs.
i want to try my hbox on this game. reiza you just earned a paying customer= next game i buy is game stock car extreme, wanted it for a while anyway. yet i am not a corporate fascist slave so they might starve me to death first. food for the cat is more important than games...

author: {'steamid': '76561198002705267', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1573927190}
review:
Le plus gros point fort de ce jeu est de permettre de d√©couvrir les circuits du Br√©sil car hormis Interlagos que beaucoup connaisent les autres sont inconnu.

Le moteur graphique est celui de rfactor qui a fait ses preuves par le pass√© bien qu'il commence √† montrer des signes de vielliesses. 

Ce jeu est gratuit (et non F2P), mode solo assez complet, course simple, entrainement, championnat. Pas de mode multi.

Si vous √™tes un fan assidus d'Assetto Corsa pass√© votre chemin, si vous chercher une petite simu pour passer le temps Copa Petrobras de Marcas est id√©al.

Je poss√®de Raceroom (F2P) et GRID Autosport et je dois dire que je prend plaisir malgr√© tout √† jouer √† ce jeu.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961676493', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1431156833}
review:
only needed to play this game for a few minutes to come to the conclusion that it will be staying in my library, physics feel good, forcefeedback is a bit meh, but no big deal, for a free game this really is well worth it, i havent tried it with a controller but if you have a steering wheel, get it, you have nothing to lose!

Pros
*FREE(i would happily pay for dlc)
*Fairly good physics (not perfect but passable)
*Passable graphically considering its DX9
*Plenty of controller support
*Sounds are good

Cons
*Lack of content (but for free who can really complain about that)
*No multiplayer options at all
*Gravel trap is more like Ice
*Forcefeedback kinda sux
*Forced throttle blip(maybe this can be disabled but as far as im aware all assists were off)
*imo all the cars sound very similar (they might even be identical i havent looked into it)

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198005911372', 'num_games_owned': 566, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1448661739}
review: What a Wonderful free game!! This game is by the same folks who make the absolutely amazing Game Stock Car (which is one of the best Sim Racing titles availabe).  I don't own the steam version of GSC, but have played several hours of it (and the Copa Petrobras series in it) and have had a blast.  If you enjoy CPdM, then please consider Game Stock Car.  You can download a mod of just about any car that has wheels and most any track you can think of.  I still cannot believe that Reiza is giving this game away.  Thanks Reiza!!!

review: I'm extremly dissanpointed. I downloaded this game thinking it would start a race similar to that in forza motorsport. Plus, I'm used to a third person or fith person vehical view. If I could change the camera, and if it could start at the starting line rather than at the pit stop I would be happy. I would also be happy If standard cars were available(like the Mitsubishi Eclipse GTS) or exotic cars(like the Picani Zonda or the Ford GT). Thanks for reading my review, I hope these improvments can be made soon.   :)

review:
Petrobras de Marcas es una "copia" de otros juegos como Rfactor o Simraceway, utilizando el mismo motor gr√°fico ISImotor, es un simulador logrado con una calidad gr√°fica decente.

No os extra√±e que sea gratuito, ya que no supera a Simraceway como freetoplay,
la empresa brasile√±a petrobras gana miles y millones de dolares en la extracci√≥n de petroleo y toda la cadena que le sigue, son los pioneros mas grandes en perforaci√≥n, extracci√≥n, refinamiento, esta declarada una de las 500 empresas mas grandes de el mundo, y de las mas ricas.

El juego "simulador" no esta mal es, divertido para ser un jugador y gratuito, pero mas faltar√≠a que no lo fuera habiendo de mejores, lo recomiendo a los que les encanten los simuladores sobre todo a los que dispongan de volante, ya que se disfruta mas que con un simple gamepad, las opciones de configuraci√≥n son muy amplias, ya que te permite retocar infinidad de configuraciones muy t√©cnicas incluso dentro de el juego, 

como por ejemplo:
Asistentes de conducci√≥n, de estabilidad y de frenada
ajustes muy personal√≠zales, camaras, boxes,
inclinacion de coche, peso, cantidad de fuel, presion en neum√°ticos... 
pru√©balo y juzga por ti mismo.

saludos!

review:
El modelado de los circuitos y coches muy buenos.
Las f√≠sicas de los coches muy logradas (salvo que personalmente los coches de tracci√≥n delantera los detesto).

L√°stima que tenga "coraz√≥n" de rFactor1, un juego del 2005 al que le pesan los a√±os. Reiza ha echo un gran trabajo con los modelados y f√≠sicas, mejorando incluso lo que fu√© rFactor1 en su lanzamiento, el problema es que no le encuentro utilidad un mod F2P sin multijugador, es como tener un juego pirata sin online pero con la √∫nica ventaja de descargarlo desde Steam.

Desde luego √©ste juego no gustar√° a la gente casual que juegue con gamepad o teclado, ya que se trata de un simulador.

Lo recomiendo si te quieres iniciar de alguna forma en el mundo de la simulaci√≥n con la IA ya que adem√°s los coches son sencillos, pero no lo recomiendo si buscas carreras emocionantes con personas reales.

review:
Das Spiel ist recht gut gestaltet, die Grafik bisher in Ordnung, jedoch h√§tte man das Men√º √ºbersichtlicher gestalten k√∂nnen, gerade das Optionsmen√º war nicht ganz √ºbersichtlich.
Dann ben√∂tige ich 5 Minuten, um alle Tasten mit den Funktionen zu belegen, die ich im Spiel ben√∂tige.

Die Autos im Spiel reagieren bei mir in der Lenkung ziemlich stark und drehen schon das ein oder andere Mal durch, aber ansonsten finde ich es gut.
Schade, dass es kein Multiplayer besitzt, dann w√ºrde es sicher noch mehr Spa√ü machen.

Empfehlen kann ich es allerdings nicht, da es ein Freeware Game ist und man es eigentlich sehr schnell durch hat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116372839', 'num_games_owned': 115, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1441753698}
review: I played this game before its steam release and it made me fall in love with pc racing games. It doesn't have much content, However it is essentially a free demo of Game Stockcar. It runs on the same engine that GSC and Rfactor use. It is amazing quality for a free game so I would suggest to anyone unsure about buying games like rfactor or GSC play this. It is the perfect introduction to the 2 games and their interface. One of, if not my favourite free game on steam

author: {'steamid': '76561197998564141', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 394, 'last_played': 1430272500}
review:
Um excelente simulador NACIONAL e GRATUITO!

-Tem alguns bugs, √© verdade!
-A jogabilidade n√£o √© perfeita, √© verdade!
-O gr√°fico est√° ultrapassado, √© verdade!
-Existem diversos outros defeitos n√£o citados, √© verdade!

Mas gente, por favor! √â um jogo feito no Brasil, com pistas do Brasil, equipes, pilotos, carros do Brasil e √© de GRA√áA! N√£o sejam Haters, o jogo √© muito bom, tenho mais de 200 jogos em minha conta, alguns simuladores feitos, inclusive, na mesma engine em que o "Copa Petrobras de Marcas" foi desenvolvido e posso falar com propriedade que ele n√£o fica para tr√°s, d√° para ter simula√ß√£o e divers√£o na mesma medida, lembrando que √© GRATUITO. A minha √∫nica e verdadeira decep√ß√£o √© o fato de n√£o haver MULTIPLAYER, o resto d√° pra relevar de boa!

OBS: S√≥ n√£o tente jogar no teclado, porque este jogo foi feito na mesma engine e segue o mesmo par√¢metro de: rFactor, Race 07 dentre outros jogos nos mesmos moldes, s√£o simuladores e o grande diferencial destes jogos √© trazer a dificuldade de segurar um carro a 200km/h para o mundo virtual, sensa√ß√£o que infelizmente s√≥ com um volante bom e com force feedback pode trazer, mas a divers√£o quem faz √© voc√™!

RECOMENDAD√çSSIMO!

14/04/2015

author: {'steamid': '76561198035510280', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1428984702}
review:
Med√≠ocre como um joguinho. Nunca pode ser chamado de simulador.

Os gr√°ficos s√£o de 2 (duas) gera√ß√µes atr√°s. Mesmo no "ultra" fica super mal acabado, sem grama e texturas porcas.

O Force Feedback n√£o teve a aten√ß√£o dos desenvolvedores, pois √© porco. Mal pude sentir o carro mesmo com tal efeito em 100 % de intensidade. Uso um Logitech G27 que s√≥ atua nas curvas quando configurado a 900¬∞ uma vez passado dos  180¬∞.
A embreagem tamb√©m foi esquecida, visto que tem-se que acelerar muito o carro para sair devagar.

A f√≠sica do jogo deixa muito a desejar. O "Safety car" √© INDESTRUT√çVEL. Esbarrar no mesmo a 60 km/h j√° faz-lhe perder 2 (duas) rodas. 
√â praticamente IMPOSS√çVEL perder a tra√ß√£o nesse jogo. Desabilitei todas as assist√™ncias desde o in√≠cio e o carro s√≥ derrapa a mais de 130 km/h quando eu o bambeio na pista e, quando o faz, torna-se incontrol√°vel.
As placas no entorno da pista s√£o de papel√£o.

review:
12/10
Abri o jogo, me deparei com uma tela de windows98, logo quando abri percebi seu alto potencial grafico, claramente uma nostalgica referencia aos tempos de ps1, comecei a jogar, uma gameplay simplesmente inovadora, acelerar com a tecla A e virar com as teclas "," e ".", simplesmente inovador, nao tenho o que comentar, iniciei a corrida, ja me deparei com incriveis seres humanos tao bem modelados quanto meu char no tibia, nao demorei a me adaptar a nova jogabilidade, comandos genialmente planejados.
Por isso 12/10
Iria fazer a opera√ßao Lava Jato para esse jogo denovo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980373414', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1428964300}
review:
It is basically a mod for a pretty old sim titled rFactor. Many more stand-alone games are available, and a sh*tstorm of mods. I've read so many "I know sims and this is good, other played 0.02h, they know sh*t" reviews, and now I know why... Because anyone who knows that this is an rF mod, just deletes than goes back to Simraceway (which is also an rF based game, but with a living/growing community and online tournaments... also free with micropayment...). So there is kinda no point playing this game :/

(P.S.: no mouse steering... engine has that feature built in...)

review:
Antes de nada tenemos que tener en cuenta que se trata de un juego gratuito.

Dispone de unos cuantos coches, circuitos, modo campeonato... los gr√°ficos me recuerdan bastante al RACE, con lo que sin ser los m√°s modernos y llamativos, pues cumplen bien, adem√°s el control es bueno.

Tal vez el punto negativo m√°s destacado que he encontrado sea el hecho que los men√∫s resultan liosos, en general toda la GUI es poco intuitiva.

Bajo mi punto de vista, vale la pena aprovechar que es gratuito y disfrutarlo unas cuantas partidas. Lo recomiendo!

author: {'steamid': '76561198058093762', 'num_games_owned': 484, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1440459173}
review:
Esse game √© uma boa op√ß√£o para passar um tempo. Possui uma jogabilidade f√°cil e o interior dos carros √© at√© muito bem feito (por outro lado a parte externa me deixou um pouco √† desejar). As pistas poderiam ter mais detalhes e um sistema de danos e colis√£o teria acrescentado muito mais realismo ao jogo.
Se voc√™ est√° procurando por uma experi√™ncia ultra realista, este com certeza n√£o √© o jogo, mas se quer apenas se divertir v√° em frente, IT'S FREE!

author: {'steamid': '76561198010046946', 'num_games_owned': 561, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1429453326}
review:
"Avalia√ß√µes neutras" 

isso √© o que acontece quando as crian√ßas do Need for Speed resolvem jogar um simulador de corridas de verdade. "AAAAIIIIINNN, A JOGABILIDADE √â HORR√çVEL", "AAAIIINNN, QUE GR√ÅFICO FEIOUN", pfff...

Enfim, meu tempo de jogo no Steam talvez indique que eu nem encostei no jogo, mas o fato √© que eu joguei o Copa antes de ele sair no Steam, e dediquei uma boa quantidade de horas nele. Sim, √© verdade que o jogo n√£o tem visuais matadores, afinal de contas, porque usa um engine com mais de dez anos nas costas. Mesmo assim, n√£o √© terrivelmente feio quando em movimento. Uma caracter√≠stica dos jogos feitos nesse engine (grande parte dos melhores simuladores de corrida o utiliza) √© a excepcional capacidade de se lidar com os detalhes realmente importantes de um SIMULADOR de corridas (coisa que essa galerinha do Need for Speed n√£o sabe o que √©), como uma f√≠sica realista e a intelig√™ncia artificial dos advers√°rios que, no Copa, assim como nos outros jogos que o utilizam, s√£o excepcionais. Ele foi produzido pela Reiza, o mesmo est√∫dio que produziu o elogiad√≠ssimo Game StockCar Extreme, que √© utilizado como simulador e meio de treinamento pelos pr√≥prios pilotos da StockCar (ver aqui: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yTIiGZ7F7GE ).

Entenda, o Copa √© um jogo gratuito produzido para fins publicit√°rios. Portanto, n√£o espere a mais extensa lista de carros e pistas, mas o que tem nele √© o bastante para entreter qualquer aficionado por simuladores de corrida. Ele simula o Campeonato Brasileiro de Marcas, tamb√©m conhecido como Copa Petrobras de Marcas, mas sem os nomes reais dos pilotos, com alguns modelos desatualizados em rela√ß√£o aos que correm atualmente, e sem o Honda Civic. Mas voc√™ ainda tem o Chevrolet Cruze, o Ford Focus, o Toyota Corola e o Mitsubishi Lancer pra brincar nos aut√≥dromos brasileiros como Interlagos, Goi√¢nia, Velopark, etc.

√â recomendado usar um volante de qualidade para aproveitar o jogo, mas n√£o √© algo obrigat√≥rio. Se voc√™ procura um √≥timo simulador de carros de rua com tra√ß√£o dianteira, preparados para as pistas, o Copa √© imperd√≠vel. E o melhor, de gra√ßa! E essa talvez seja sua maldi√ß√£o, porque sendo gratuito, ele acaba atraindo todo tipo de doido que n√£o entende sua proposta, e sai falando mal por a√≠. √â meio como o maluco reclamar de Flight Simulator porque ele n√£o √© t√£o *NeScAu RaDiCaL* quanto Ace Combat.

Ent√£o, se voc√™ faz parte da tchurminha do barulho que curte um bate-bate, tiro porrada e bomba, v√° l√° procurar um Need for Speed ou Burnout, que se adequem mais ao seu gosto. Se voc√™ curte simula√ß√£o, seja bem vindo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073239591', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1518109089}
review:
Bei Copa Petrobras de Marcas handelt sich um einen kostenlos zu spielenden Teil vom Spiel Stock Car Extreme.

Man darf ein paar Tourenwagen auf 6 brasilianischen Rennstrecken fahren. Kein Multiplayer.
Alle die Stock Car Extreme haben brauchen also dieses Spiel nicht auch noch installieren.

F√ºr alle anderen in Kurzform:
FFB fantastisch (zumindest mit Fanatec-Lenkrad). Grafik ok. L√§uft auch noch gut auf √§lteren Rechnern.

Da das Spiel umsonst ist, kann man das empfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987999389', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1428910519}
review:
Este juego es un MUY BUEN SIMULADOR de conducci√≥n y por lo tanto NECESITA ser jugado con volante o como minimo con un mando de xbox o similar porque requiere usar los gatillos y el joystick anal√≥gico. Por lo tanto si no estas habituado a este tipo de juegos (GTR, rFactor, RACE) las primeras horas se te van a hacer cuesta arriba si no disfrutas de la conducci√≥n de vehiculos.

Los controles son configurables al extremo pudiento has controlar las zonas muertas de nuestros mandos. Este punto es muy apreciado por los amantes del genero simulador pero odiado por los que solo quieren un juego rapido tipo Gran Turismo, pero como ya he dicho este juego es un completo simulador y no  un juego arcade como lo son Forza Motorsport o el antes mencionado Gran Turismo.

Los graficos cumplen perfectamente y carecen de efectos de postprocesado tipicos en los juegos arcade. Si no sabeis de que hablo pensad en la saga GRID y como se ve, ya que es quien mas los usa. Unicamente se le echa en falta mayor cantidad de detalles extras en las pistas para recrearnos mas la vista.

El sonido tambien pasa la prueba limitandose estos a reproducirnos fielmente los sonidos del coche y del circuito donde corremos.

Por lo tanto estamos ante un muy buen juego de simulaci√≥n con un aspecto grafico que ya tenian juegos del 2009, pero que resultar√° del agrado de aquellos que solo quieren experimentar el placer de conducir.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030889960', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1428871402}
review:
The most advanced and user friendly game and control I've ever seen.
I do have the impression the developer team had never played a racing game in their life.
It is very interesting to have a clutch, I think games like Forza and Gran Turismo can rock with this concept, but I would suggest that all the players would start with automatic and then they would have the opportunity to use manual or even clutch. Or a tutorial would help.
Well I will stop my critics here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043478796', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1428847526}
review:
I actually don't get it why this game has mixed reviews! Only %68 why? [b]The game is free, actually completely free. [/b]it has better ai then Assetto Corsa for gods sake. I hope this game gets good reviews and updates. 
[b]If you have questions Ask me below :) [/b]

[b]Pros[/b][list]
[*] It has wheel setups, choose your wheel and game helps with the setup.
[*] It has decent AI drivers. (After many many many updates Assetto Corsa still doesnt have good ai drivers at all)
[*] Cars are fun to drive. 
[*] Can use the stick shifter and shifting light for G27. (After many many many updates Assetto Corsa still cant use the shifting light!)
[*] Couple tracks + Couple cars.
[*] Optimized good. Can run the game at max 1080p60fps easily!
[*] Decent simulation - racing game.
[/list]

[b]Cons[/b][list]
[*] Graphics are a bit old. i actually dont care that much
[*] I cant make it show the map in race mode
[*] Brakes seems to be overpowered. Cars can slow down suprisingly fast.
[*] Engine sounds etc. lets say not the best but still playable :)
[/list]

Edit: Pros and Cons edited for easier reading.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010883390', 'num_games_owned': 159, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1428840030}
review:
I had a quick go, no driving aids no adjustment to wheel settings yet and still found it drivable. So don't listen to anyone who says it isnt! 

Lots of understeer and poor line, but thats because i havent got a feel for the car or changed any settings yet:
(Sorry for no sound on the video, I don't know why shadowplay didn't record it)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PXJ6oOm26nc

It drives well, good FF (though i havent adjusted to my taste yet) and an extra series of racing for my collection that I didn't have previously. Looks nice enough, though it isn't RaceRoom or Asseto Corsa and the like, seems a bit older maybe like rfactor? - notsure as i havent played that ether). Sounds are pretty good on the car i drove, nice representation of Intellagos but beware the added chicane just before pits! 

Great for free, many thanks to the devs.

6.8 / 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198022343549', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1428713762}
review:
Gostei muito do jogo, apesar de ser free, tem toda a qualidade de um game produzido pela Reiza, quem gosta de simracing conhece e reconhece o trabalho que esse pessoal faz. OS ajustes s√£o necess√°rios para fica a gosto do fregues, mas n√£o leva 5 minutos. O feeling do carro e o force feedback s√£o demais, o detalhamento das  pistas e o capricho em reproduzir detalhes tanto do carro quanto do ambiente faz desse titulo um must have!

I really enjoyed the game, despite being free, has all the quality of a game produced by Reiza, those who like simracing knows and recognizes the work that these people do. Adjustments are needed to make the game more accurate whit your own style, but does not take more than five minutes. The car feeling and force feedback are awesome, the details of the tracks and the whim to reproduce details of both the car and the environment makes this title a must have!

author: {'steamid': '76561198079145595', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1459262005}
review:
Use a steering wheel. Then you`ll understand. The Force Feedback is great and racing is fun. Many options for configuring races and controls (button mapping, driving aids, number of laps and ai drivers etc.). 
There are only 4 cars and 6 tracks, but that`s okay for a free game.  The graphics are ok. Don`t expect too much, but it`s still quite a nice view. Would drive again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043713041', 'num_games_owned': 448, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1442163989}
review:
[b]This is an amazing Racing Simulator.[/b] The controls are quite nice and smooth, even with my crappy old racing wheel. [b]Graphics are OK[/b], they aren't PS4 standards... They feel... 2010'ish, but still pleasing to look at, it works for what it is quite well. [b]The customization and options are unbeliveble![/b] You can change a lot of stuff to your liking, even on the camera, it's the first racing game i've seen that you can adjust the angle of the third person camera, its really neat!

[b]The game suffers a little bit on the HUD department tho[/b], kinda barebones and there isn't a map, like other racing games usually have (unless it's hidden on some option menu i havent found)... also, [b]the menus aren't the most intuitive and user-friendly[/b], you will have to spend some time to fiddle with the options to find what you need, but when you get everything set up to your controller, it will be a blast!

Some people seem to have problem playing with the keyboard, but since i played with a racing wheel, i cant say... even tho the game has a lot of options, with some patience, you probably can make any controller work fine!

If it had multiplayer i would gladly pay for it, [b]it's a really nice game![/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198079481439', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1428696832}
review: If you are looking for a realistic racing game, look no further. The fact that it is free might turn you off to downloading it, but trust me it is worth it. The only racing games I usually play are Need for Speed and Forza, and this game was kind of hard to get use to at first, but it was incredibly fun once i learned it. This game is chock full of features and controls. It runs very good on low end PCs and laptops. The cars handle pretty realistically and sound amazing. The only problem I have with this game is the lack of cars (which I'm sure they will add more) and the recycle bin sound when exiting a menu..... haha.  But overall this game is a steal for free. I hope to see more cars and improvements, of course. I'll rate this game a 8.5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062232026', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1434163787}
review:
To gamers who wants to try this game. Please 'o' please don't listen to these imbaciles giving a negative reviews of a proper racing simulator. 

Starting things off, there is currently no way you could enjoy a proper racing game without investing time to set it up first. Look at those negative reviews, they barely even scratched the iceberg with 0.2/0.5 hours of gameplay? 
I've been playing a lot of racing simulators so I know my way around setting it up.

Now, ehem, this game is a lot for a free game. Heck you get all 4 licensed for not a single penny! They put a lot of effort in this game, especially in the FBB I love how it feels, how the car slides, how you lose grip when you hit a curb. The graphics is by far descent. I'm playing with n i3 and a GTX750 and I can run it max, talk about optimization. The AI is just wonderful, clearly a large amount of effort was put into this. (Now I think you're saying why are they saying the AI is bad? Well did you actually think those players are good? Food for thought) 

Bottom line I say, if you have a gaming steering wheel you got to try this out. I know you have interest in simulations since you looked this up, I know too you are more capable than these fools that complains just about everything. 

And to the Devs, well done sirs and madams well done.

review:

Contras:

author: {'steamid': '76561198171726506', 'num_games_owned': 43, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1429885421}
review:
This is a great racing SIMULATOR and i really enjoy it. I really wasnt expecting it to be as good as it really is but trust me, if you have a ffb wheel you got to give this a try.


PROS

-The A.I is REALLY good, its one of the few A.I¬¥s i actually enjoy racing. 

-Decent amout of tracks

-Good physics

-Good rolling starts

-You pretty much get a complete racing simulator for FREE

CONS

-Not a lot of cars, but it have the cars it needs

-Can be a little bit tricky to get started with the settings



And for you who complain about the keyboard controllers, this was made for force feedback wheels and not kb/m controlls

author: {'steamid': '76561198006207349', 'num_games_owned': 264, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1428613187}

spent 10 minutes fixing settings, 2 minutes playing which was plenty enough.

on a serious note, brakes weren't all that fantastic, controls are abnormal for a racing game in my eyes. it's probably a lot better with a wheel but mine broke a while ago so i cannot test that part.

sounds arent the best either but might appeal to some.

at the end of the day, it's a free game. I would give it a 5/10 but wouldn't recommend it to friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059009586', 'num_games_owned': 155, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1634759438}
review:
√© um bom simulador feito na engine do rFactor, ent√£o se voc√™ for jogar no teclado recomendo usar assistencia de dire√ß√£o, porque evidentemente haver√° dificuldade em controlar o carro sem os mesmos...ent√£o reclamar de controles n√£o justifica dar um review ruim.
as pistas nacionais est√£o at√© certo ponto (por limita√ß√£o da engine) muito bem representadas
Nota pessoal: recomendo a pista de Tarum√£,fazer o que eu moro perto xP (que alias esta faltando o "~"no nome da pista,mas isso ja √© nitpicking.)

==English==
Good simulator using rFactor engine, so if you going to use a keyboard best if driving assistence is on, because you WILL have dificulties without it... besides this complaining about hard controls doesnt justify giving a bad review.
National track have been nicely done until certain point (due to engine limitations).
Personal note: I recomend giving a try on Taruma, what i can do i live close to it xP (it has a little typo on portuguese missing the "~" but this is only for nitpicking)

author: {'steamid': '76561198035742658', 'num_games_owned': 289, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 441, 'last_played': 1428764187}
review:
First it's free, so if you like Racing sims, I cannot think of a good reason not to download this.

Second, not only is it free, it is also very well put together - fully customizable control options, excellent FFB, and great car handling and physics.

There are unbelievably some negative reivews - I can only assume they are from arcade gamers who do not want to spend any time properly setting up their controls and other settings, or are still at school and have not yet learnt to appreciate what it means to actually have to earn money to pay for a game, and therefore what it means to get a game for free. 

All I cans ay is, if you can not afford to buy a race sim, then this one may have less cars and tracks than other full release sims, but it will give you a simulation of racing that is as enjoyable as any of them.

It's also a recommended taster for Stock Car Extreme, which has many more cars of equal or higher quality.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970655913', 'num_games_owned': 421, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1456634562}
review:
UPDATE: If you liked this free game and want to take a look at the full game, [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/273840/]Stock Car Extreme[/url], go to the game's website [url=http://game-stockcar.com.br/downloads-2/?lang=en]downloads[/url] page and there you can download the entire 7.1 GB game for a free 60 minutes trial. 

On the same web page is a Lite version demo, it includes the same car, but with only two tracks. The good news is that this 30 day demo, rather than sixty minutes, and it's only 2.1 GB. 

[u]Original Review[/u]
This is a nice game that is essentially an in-depth demo for Stock Car Extreme, another racing game from the same publisher. It's very detailed with nice features like in-depth car set-up, in-race adjustments like brake bias and lots of other realism settings. It supports a variety of racing wheels, but I did just fine with my X360 controller. The graphics are a bit dated,  but better than GTR or Race 07, which it very much will remind you of if you have played those game. The nice thing about the less than bleeding edge graphics is that you don't need an uber-rig to run the game at a nice rock solid 60 fps. There are plenty of in-cockpit and other views, and a replay feature too.

There are six tracks included, including a nice "square" oval that is a good training ground for new drivers. There are all sorts of options when racing as well. Opponents can be set to any number up to sixteen, you can select rolling or standing starts, and you can also decide whether to include practice as well as qualifying sessions. 

Races can be run against a clock or by completion of a number of laps. Tire wear and fuel use can be set to normal or can be multiplied to simulate a longer session. AI driver skill can be adjusted, as well as their aggression level. 

This is a nice racing game even if you had to play a few dollars for it, but for free? It's a no-brainer, download it and give it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073478936', 'num_games_owned': 1415, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1428806311}
review:
As soon as I loaded this game up, I knew exactly what I was in for. Developed by Reiza Studios, the same folks behind the excellent Game Stock Car 2013 (Extreme now) and Formula Truck 2013 series of games, this is pretty much the same thing, but on the Brazilian stock car circuit. While not familiar with the Brazilian circuit myself, I thoroughly enjoy the aforementioned games, and anyone else that is familiar with those will feel right at home as well. This is mainly the reason that I am able to write this review with such little play time on this at the moment! 

So on to the gameplay! Once you're behind the wheel of either of three different car manufacturers (for now anyway), you'll see the familiar gMotor 2 engine used with these games, from the HUD to the ever-so-lovely shift/rpm gauge. Of course, these can be turned off (thankfully), which gives you a more realistic sim experience, if that is your cup of tea. And yes, you can change the view from the default cockpit! This is found in the Options > Display menu. There are a multitude of other settings that can be changed as well, from the number of cars seen on-screen at once to graphical settings. Most gamers with mid to high range machines can naturally max out these settings, as the graphics are not quite up to the same standards as Asetto Corsa and the likes. But, to me anyway, they look pretty good right out of the box, so to speak. This can also be said for the car handling physics, which are the same as other entries from Reiza Studios. And that is to say that they are some of the best that I have experienced in any racing game to date. Again, those that have played the games I mentioned know what I am referring to.

In summary, if you've played the other games Reiza has offered, you know what you're in for, and will feel right at home once you're in the game. If you're even remotely interested in racing games that are more of a simulation, then you should definitely give this a try. And heck, even if you don't like racing games, give it a try anyway. After all, how can you go wrong with a free game, especially one of this magnitude. What are you waiting for, add it to your Steam library right now!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198115220938', 'num_games_owned': 133, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1428779315}
review:
I can't really believe this game is free. I'm a big fan of Reiza Studios for their other sims (GSC Extreme and FT2013) which I have since their original release (before it was on Steam) and this small team gave us some of the best sims for years with those titles. 

And Copa de Marcas is no different, it's a great sim of a cool racing series with accurate models and tracks.

If you are looking for a true sim, look no further. Try this game and look for the other titles from Reiza Studios as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046837921', 'num_games_owned': 298, 'num_reviews': 267, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1428537211}
review:
It's a game that has just been released, I understand that. But the game wasn't that bad. However, there could be some changes that should be in effect, instead of what I am about to expect on a F2P racing game. 

The controls are terrible in this game. They don't save your changes, whenever you launch the game. If so, then you would have to change them again and again to fit your controls. 

I would not blame the creator of this game, but some changes would be expected ASAP.

review: The first time I saw a game patches and what is the graphics, I think the next game with boring graphics and even worse control, a person like me moves from his youth in games like Need for Speed or rally, this game is something completely different sure, there too you drive a car that has four wheels and engine, but the main maneuverability, it was hard to get used to the game, which if improperly Braking sends you in the ass, I was accustomed to the need for speed, there can easily put the handbrake and rest sweep pass drift, but not here, here, you must slow down to at least 120 / kmh bring you the up, as a big fan of racing games, I have to say, it takes a few tweaks to the game, but this game is excellent that is free, feel free to download it, at least try.
